question: Whenever there is a dispute in the presidential election, it is referred to which of the following authorities?
explanation: All doubts and disputes arising out of or in connection with the election of a President or Vice-President shall be inquired into and decided by the Supreme Court whose decision shall be final. If the election of a person as President or Vice-President is declared void by the Supreme Court, acts done by him in the exercise and performance of the powers and duties of the office of President or Vice-President, as the case may be, on or before the date of the decision of the Supreme Court shall not be invalidated by reason of that declaration. Subject to the provisions of thisÂ Constitution, Parliament may by law regulate any matter relating to or connected with the election of a President or Vice-President.
